IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The Association promotes the proven PACE (Program of All-Inclusive Care for the Elderly) program and works to expand it so that all North Carolinians have access.
IRS990.MissionDesc: PACE, or Programs of All-Inclusive Care for the Elderly, provides comprehensive health care and services that allow individuals 55 years and older who qualify for nursing home level of care to remain in the community with their family and friends. North Carolina PACE Association promotes this proven program and works to expand it so that all North Carolinians have access to PACE services. We know that PACE provides better care, an improved quality of life and is cost-effective.
IRS990.Desc: Education: The Association educates and provides technical assistance to members, related professionals and the general public through an annual conference, webinars, workshops, presentations, a website and social media, newsletters, direct responses to requests for information, and other updates.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Public Policy: The Association helps develop and grow PACE programs in North Carolina through public policy analysis, advocacy and outreach.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: The Association's fiscal year is July 1 - June 30; however, the Association began operations on January 1, 2014 so the 2013 tax year is a short, six month period (1/1-6/30/14). Other income is an unusual grant of $75,143 from the organization's previous fiscal sponsor transferred as of 1/1/14.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Association is exempt from federal and state income taxes under Section 501(a) of the Internal Revenue Code and is classified under 501(c)3 as a public charity. The Association has also been classified as an entity that is not a private foundation within the meaning of Section 509(a) and qualifies for deductible contributions provided in Section 180(b)(1)(A)(vi). It is the Association's policy to evaluate all tax positions to identify those that may be considered uncertain. All identified material tax positions are assessed by a "more-likely-than-not" threshold to determine if the benefit of any uncertain tax position should be recognized in the financial statements. Any changes in the amount of a tax position are recognized in the period the change occurs. The Association files its Form 990 series tax returns in the U.S. Federal jurisdiction. The Association's tax returns are subject to examination by the Internal Revenue Service for a period of three years after the respective filing deadline.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Association has members, as described in its bylaws (founding members, or those with operational PACE programs or market allocation as of April, 2011; provider members, or those with operational PACE programs or executed contract with the State of North Carolina; developing members, or those with an assigned service area; and exploring members, or those considering a PACE program, vendors who serve PACE organizations, or other parties as those the Board of Directors may determine in its sole discretion from time to time).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: As outlined in the Association's bylaws, Founding and Provider member organizations have voting privileges in accordance with the North Carolina Corporation Act ("NCA") and are entitled to representation on the Board of Directors. Developing members have representation on the Board of Directors, but do not have voting privileges. Exploring members do not have voting privileges and are not entitled to representation on the Corporation's Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The annual meeting of members shall be held on the date fixed by the Board of Directors, or if the Board of Directors shall fail to act, then as shall be fixed by the Chair, for the purpose of electing the members of the Board of Directors and for the additional purpose of voting on such other matters which the Board of Directors may elect to submit to the members for vote or such other matters on which the members are entitled to vote by law.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Form 990 was provided to each member of the Board of Directors for review, comment, input and oversight prior to submission.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Members of the Board annually complete a conflict of interest form and are polled for any conflicts at the beginning of each board meeting. If any contract or transaction arises before the Board of Directors, any director, officer or key employee must make a full and prompt disclosure of his/her interest before Board action is taken. The disclosure includes any relevant and material facts which may be adverse to the Association. The Board, by 75% of the vote, determines if a conflict exists or could be reasonably construed to exist. The conflicted person is then restrained from participating in Board deliberations and in voting on such matters.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: In adopting the annual budget for the organization, the governing body (the Board of Directors) approved compensation for the Association's Executive Director. The Executive Director is a non-voting member of the Board, and the only member with a conflict of interest in the decision. Members of the Board of Directors have knowledge of comparable compensation for similar positions. The decision was contemporaneously recorded in the minutes of the Board of Directors. There are no other compensated officers, officials, or key employees in the organization.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Association's governing documents and conflict of interest policy are available to the public upon request. The Form 990 is available on the organization's website.
Contractors providing public policy support, data analysis and other research, and HR/payroll services.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: INCREASE THE PROVISION OF COMPREHENSIVE HEALTH SERVICES TO OLDER ADULTS IN THE US

TransactionsRelatedOrgGrp.MethodOfAmountDeterminationTxt: Monthly invoices from July and August 2017 from National PACE Association for salary and benefits of Executive Director, recorded on an accrual basis. As of September 1, 2017, the Executive Director ceased to be an employee of National PACE Association and became an employee of North Carolina PACE Association.
